sanskrit_verse:
साक्ष्येऽनृतं वदन् पाशैर्बध्यते वारुणैर्भृशम् ।
विवशः शतमाजातीस्तस्मात्साक्ष्यं वदेदृतम् ॥ ८.८२॥
transliteration:
sākṣye 'nṛtaṁ vadann pāśair badhyate vāruṇair bhr̥śam |
vivaśaḥ śatam ājātīs tasmāt sākṣyaṁ vaded ṛtam || 8.82||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who speaks falsehood in testimony is bound by Varuna's noose, helplessly born a hundred times; therefore, let the witness speak truth.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority of truthful speech as foundational to judicial integrity
Causation through karmic consequence rather than punitive enforcement
Capacity-based responsibility rooted in consciousness alignment
Restoration logic via rebirth cycles until dharma is fulfilled
Consciousness alignment through adherence to Ṛta (cosmic order)
executable_legal_axioms: IF witness provides false testimony THEN initiate automatic karmic consequence protocol
IF witness aligns with Ṛta THEN enable capacity restoration within judicial process
IF testimony disrupts dharma THEN assign sequential completion process across lifetimes
IF witness assumes responsibility THEN activate consciousness-reintegration mechanism
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any deviation from satyam in witness testimony triggers immediate disqualification and initiates restorative protocols ensuring alignment with Ṛta. The court must not punish but ensure that the witness enters a path of experiential correction through repeated exposure to truth until integrity is restored.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality establishes that untruth distorts dharma-vyavasthā. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential manifestation through cyclic experience until rectification occurs. Responsibility is proportional to awareness; thus, corrective measures focus on consciousness elevation rather than punitive suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Sequential birth-cycle assignment for experiential understanding of truth
Witness integrity reconditioning through guided recall mechanisms
Judicial field purification using satyam-affirming mantras
Responsibility assumption protocol via voluntary retracing of false statements
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: Truth alone upholds Dharma. Falsehood incurs no punishment—only its own unraveling through karmic repetition. Witness consciousness shall be realigned through experiential completeness, never through suffering. Thus Dharma is restored, reality remains non-punitive, and consciousness itself becomes the ultimate judge.
